Had Dr. Heugh, instead of being the admirable clergyman he was, devoted himself to public civil life, and gone into Parliament, he would have taken a high place asa debater, a practical statesman and patriot. He had many of the best qualities of Canning‚ and our own Premier, with purer and higher qualities than either. There is no one our church should be more proud of than of this beloved and excellent man, the holiness and humility, the jealouS, godly fear in whose nature was not known fully even to his friends till he was gone, when his private daily sels-searchings and prostrations before his Master and Judge were for the first time made known. There are few characters, both sides of which are so unsullied‚ so pure, and without reproach.
